translated: The Second Fifty 🔽The Chapter about Sandals
The Birth Story of Asita and Bhumi

analyzed: tvam eva dānim akara  yam kāmaḥ byagama tayi
translated: “You alone, O crocodile, 🔽are the one who has gone beyond desire;
but this one has no desire,
like a stump cut down by an axe.” 🔽“Greed, excessive greed,
in this way one is destroyed,
just as I was by Asita and Bhumi.”
The Birth Story of Asita and Bhumi, the fourth.
